children.subject: Yes it is! We host and run the DeCal every semester. You can find out more info at webatberkeley.org!
That looks really interesting! Is the decal related to the club web development @ Berkeley by any chance?

Thanks for your interest! It does need a bit more commitment than the usual decal (hence the 3 units). We have two 1.5 hours, and it would take on average 2 hours to finish the homework/projects each week. We do provide lots of hand-holding/office hours/project parties throughout the semester.
How is the time commitment for this decal? It looks pretty interesting, but it also looks pretty time-consuming and my schedule is a bit busy already.
Yes! We will also offer this decal in the spring semester.
Will this DeCal also be offered in the spring?
Hey! Unfortunately, Forms only lets us limit by character, but we just expanded it by a little- feel free to let us know if you're still unable to fit your essay!
Hi, I tried to write the application but even though I wrote my essay under 250 words, it keeps saying in red that max words is 250. Can you check this issue? Thanks!
Hi thanks for your interest in our Decal! We will send out the application results by Wednesday morning.
When will we get notified about whether or not we got into the decal?

history.content:
Want to create your own personal website but don't know how to get started? Ever thought about making your startup idea come true? We got you covered! Introducing the Intro to Full-Stack Development Decal. We will help you build your web development skill sets from the ground up. Through a series of carefully crafted and tested lessons and homework, you will be learning from HTML & CSS to the best and the most widely used frameworks & databases in the industry. At the end of the course, you will have the chance to be working in a team of four to create a full-fledged web project that will go on your resume!

The best thing is, you don't need to know coding at all! We will start from the fundamentals of programming and guide you to explore the complex web development world. You will be learning...

  • HTML, CSS, JS
  • Fundamentals of the Internet
  • React.js
  • Node.js & Django
  • PostgreSQL & MongoDB
  • Cloud Technologies
  • and more!

The course is a three-unit remote DeCal with optional in-person office hours & project parties. Visit our website to learn more about our DeCal: fullstackdecal.com. You can also learn webatberkeley.org to learn more about Web Development at Berkeley, the organization hosting and running the Full-Stack DeCal.

If you are interested, please fill out the interest form to stay updated on infosessions and deadlines. You can also find the application form here:

  • interest form: http://tinyurl.com/wdb-interest-form
  • application form: https://forms.gle/TtiM1f2ZqdjBEU1R7

Applications are due September 7th at 11:59PM pacific time, and we'll have infosessions for the course on August 30th and September 1st, and more information can be found on our website. We look forward to a great semester!

Go bears!
